summary: This is an email chain from July 16, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff. It discusses that a former DOJ official, referenced in court the previous day regarding the review of Jeffrey Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), has retained counsel and is considering a public statement due to negative press coverage.

connections.description: Defense counsel mentioned S on the record in court the day before this email, identifying her as a former DOJ official involved in reviewing the Epstein NPA.

events.title: Court Mention of Former DOJ Official
events.description: During a court proceeding, defense counsel mentioned on the record a former DOJ official (S) who had been involved in reviewing the Jeffrey Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Former DOJ Official Considers Public Statement
events.description: The former DOJ official (S), upset about subsequent press coverage, retained counsel and is considering making a public statement regarding her involvement in the Epstein NPA review.

keyFacts: A former DOJ official, referred to as 'S', was involved in reviewing Jeffrey Epstein's 2007/2008 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
This official was named on the record by defense counsel during a court proceeding on July 15, 2019.
By July 16, 2019, the official had retained legal counsel and was considering a public statement due to being upset about press coverage following the court mention.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding this development.
